p:
To allow for unambiguous identification of edge structures in STM during HDS, we chose the simple CH 3SH molecule as our organosulfur compound to be desulfurized. Naturally, a single organosulfur compound can never fully represent the complex mixture in oil. However, mercaptans such as CH 3SH constitute a major component in crude oil
23 . Our applied temperature and pressure (250 °C, 1 bar) are close to the typical hydrodesulfurization conditions applied for the light naphtha fraction (260–380 °C, 5–10 bar)
2 and are sufficient to achieve catalytic turnover
24 .
